entry.title: Young Heroes
entry.summary:
Author: ilona2nerrie

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,109Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 26

Summary: When Gotham's pollution and Bruce's bad decisions start to catch up on him, Alfred had to take action to keep his young ward alive.Being sent to a small town in Kansas was one of the thing's the young Wayne never expected put of life. But the family he's been sent to live with is ok, he guesses. and even if he detests the heat. being forced to actually sleep, and the farmwork, his new roommate and, dare he say, friend was actually nice.

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,466Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 40

entry.title: Pregnancy is the greatest gift- Why are you screaming?
entry.summary:
Author: Thatoneautisticshark

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,140Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 70

Summary: Bruce stared at the counter in total disbelief. That could not be right. There was no way.He hadn't had a hysterectomy, sure. But he'd had top surgery and been on hormones for years. There was no possible way he could be actually pregnant.But the five separate positive tests on the counter were glaringly obvious.Technically he could have possibly got pregnant but it was statistically impossible. Who would it even have been from, one of the hookups for his Brucie persona surely.

Clark travels in time to meet Bruce, and the two seemed destined to be together.

entry.summary:
Author: battinscnz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,823Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 120

Summary: Bruce Wayne is no stranger to the spotlight‚Äîor the shadows it casts. Reclusive, haunted by tragedy, and heir to a name that carries more weight than comfort, he now faces something far more personal than public scrutiny: a stalker. The letters arrive like clockwork‚Äîtaunting, obsessive, familiar. And with Halloween approaching‚Äîthe anniversary of his parents' death‚Äîthe tension coils tighter.Clark Kent is a disciplined, quietly intense MMA-trained security specialist, brought in under General Sam Lane‚Äôs orders to keep Bruce safe. He expects a job. He doesn‚Äôt expect the gothic cold of Wayne Manor, the brooding silence of its only resident, or the unsettling depth of what Bruce refuses to say out loud.But as danger creeps closer, and the mystery surrounding the stalker sharpens, Bruce and Clark are forced into uncomfortable proximity. What begins as resistance slowly becomes something deeper‚Äîsomething fragile and real.
